summary: The Security Council, recalling its previous resolutions on the Central African Republic, determines that the situation continues to threaten international peace and security. Acting under Chapter VII, it authorizes an increase of 750 military personnel, 280 police personnel, and 20 corrections officers for MINUSCA, in addition to those authorized by resolution 2149 (2014). The Secretary-General is requested to continuously review the new personnel levels in MINUSCA. The Council remains actively seized of the matter.
